docs.lead_paragraph: Banned Iranian director Jafar Panahi's "Taxi," which shows a cabby driving an odd assortment of people around Tehran but is really a condemnation of censorship, won the Golden Bear for best film on Saturday at the Berlin International Film Festival.

headline.main: Banned Iranian Director Panahi's 'Taxi' Wins Berlin's Golden Bear
headline.print_headline: Banned Iranian Director Panahi's 'Taxi' Wins Berlin's Golden Bear

docs.snippet: Banned Iranian director Jafar Panahi's "Taxi," which shows a cabby driving an odd assortment of people around Tehran but is really a condemnation of censorship, won the Golden Bear for best film on Saturday at the Berlin International Film Festival.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three people exemplify those who find meaning, purpose and even social justice in their postcareer work.

headline.main: Retirees Find Meaning Serving the Needs of Their Communities
headline.print_headline: Retirees Find Meaning Serving the Needs of Their Communities

docs.abstract: Retiring column; nonprofit Encore.org bestows Purpose Prize fellowships on retirees Gloria Carter Dickerson, Peter Rosten and Josephine Mercado, who have all dedicated their later years to community service.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health officials announced a new campaign Friday to promote New York City's condom giveaway program, which distributes tens of millions of condoms annually in an effort to prevent sexually transmitted diseases and unplanned pregnancies.

headline.main: Health Officials Visit Sex Museum to Promote Condom Handouts
headline.print_headline: Health Officials Visit Sex Museum to Promote Condom Handouts

docs.snippet: Health officials announced a new campaign Friday to promote New York City's condom giveaway program, which distributes tens of millions of condoms annually in an effort to prevent sexually transmitted diseases and unplanned pregnancies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Frisch’s work showed that women without enough body fat would have trouble becoming pregnant but also had a lower risk of breast cancer.

headline.main: Rose E. Frisch, Scientist Who Linked Body Fat to Fertility, Dies at 96
headline.print_headline: Rose Frisch, 96, Scientist Who Linked Fat to Fertility

docs.abstract: Rose E Frisch, scientist whose work showed that women without enough body fat would have trouble becoming pregnant but also had a lower risk of breast cancer, dies at age 96.
docs.snippet: Dr. Frisch’s work showed that women without enough body fat would have trouble becoming pregnant but also had a lower risk of breast cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: Married before her 18th birthday, Nirma Chaudhary could have ended up like thousands of other child brides in India's desert state of Rajasthan - forced to quit school and consigned to a life as a wife and mother.

headline.main: Women Firefighters Extinguish Stereotypes in India's Land of Child Brides
headline.print_headline: Women Firefighters Extinguish Stereotypes in India's Land of Child Brides

headline.main: Premature Delivery Tied to Heart Risks in Mother

docs.abstract: Premature delivery is tied to increased heart risks in the mother, a review of studies has found.
docs.snippet: Premature delivery is tied to increased heart risks in the mother, a review of studies has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bangkok city officials are urging young Thais to forgo sex on Valentine's Day this weekend and visit temples instead, as a far better way to mark the day of love.

headline.main: Bangkok Tells Young People to Keep Minds Off Sex on Valentine's Day
headline.print_headline: Bangkok Tells Young People to Keep Minds Off Sex on Valentine's Day
